alert.note: Alert for Washington (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 7:37AM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Clark and southeastern Washington Counties through 815 AM EDT... At 737 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southeast of Salem, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Washington and northwestern Clark Counties in south central Indiana, including the following locations... New Pekin, Blue Lick, Farabee, Chestnut Hill, Daisy Hill, Borden, Blue River, New Liberty and Memphis. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
